New Records: Abdullah Shafique and Mohammad Rizwan bettered the previous successful chase of 328 set by Ireland when they stunned England at the 2011 World Cup
Key Match Events: Kusal Mendis smashed the fastest century for Sri Lanka in a World Cup match on his way to 122
Mendis and Samarawickrama showed plenty of aggression in the middle overs with a 111-run third-wicket stand off 69 balls
Dilshan Madushanka got the key wickets in the powerplay as Imam pulled to fine leg and captain Babar Azam (10) edged a leg-side flick to the wicketkeeper
Shafique and Rizwan then began Pakistan’s second-highest-ever run chase in an ODI
Shafique and Rizwan hit eight fours and three sixes
Hasan Ali picked up 4 wickets for 71 runs
Imam-ul-Haq dropped a sharp chance at point
Haris Rauf picked up both his wickets in the final over
Post-Match Reflections: Rizwan said, 'It’s always a proud memory when you perform for your country. It was difficult because when you chase like that it’s always special. When we went to the dressing room every player believed we were going to chase that. This is a team game and we decided to go with a deep partnership.'

Sri Lanka’s captain, Dasun Shanaka, tried to remain positive about the performance – especially by his two centurions. He said, 'I’m really happy about the way both of the guys played, but we should have finished a bit stronger than this. We have to look at the areas we bowled and the number of extras. The only way is to encourage [them]. We had our chances in the field but missed a lot today.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan stretched its Cricket World Cup record against Sri Lanka to 8-0
Pakistan now has four points from two victories after beating both the qualifiers – the Netherlands and Sri Lanka
Going into the marquee game against archrivals India in Ahmedabad on Saturday
England beat Bangladesh by 137 runs with Dawid Malan scoring 140 off 107 balls
Others: Sri Lanka’s bowlers got walloped from both sides on a perfect batting pitch
England’s fourth-biggest win by runs in World Cup history
Malan hit 16 fours and five sixes overall, and reached his 100 off 91 balls
Malan cut loose to score 40 off only 16 balls, hitting four fours and three sixes
